q: Life comes at us in waves. We can't predict or control those waves, but we can learn to surf.
h:
“Life comes at us in waves. We can't predict or control those waves, but we can learn to surf.” —
Dan Millman

q: The power of man has grown in every sphere, except over himself.
h:
“The power of man has grown in every sphere, except over himself.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
h:
“Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: It is secondary whether we choose belief or defiance. What is precious is that we are always able to choose.
h:
“It is secondary whether we choose belief or defiance. What is precious is that we are always able to choose.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: If you focus on success, you'll have stress. But if you pursue excellence, success will be guaranteed.
h:
“If you focus on success, you'll have stress. But if you pursue excellence, success will be guaranteed.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: If you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don't throw it away.
h:
“If you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don't throw it away.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: You can't have anything worthwhile without difficulties.
h:
“You can't have anything worthwhile without difficulties.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: Within every desire is the mechanics of its fulfillment.
h:
“Within every desire is the mechanics of its fulfillment.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: You cannot have a positive life and a negative mind.
h:
“You cannot have a positive life and a negative mind.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: It's possible in ways both large or small to make a difference in someone's life.
h:
“It's possible in ways both large or small to make a difference in someone's life.” —
Yanni

q:
It is safer to search in the maze than to remain in 
a cheeseless situation.
h:
“It is safer to search in the maze than to remain in a cheeseless situation.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: Do it with passion, or not at all.
h:
“Do it with passion, or not at all.” —
Rosa Nouchette Carey

q: Don't concern yourself with the money. Be of service. Build. Work. Dream. Create.
h:
“Don't concern yourself with the money. Be of service. Build. Work. Dream. Create.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
h:
“The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.” —
Walt Disney

q: Don't gain the world and lose your soul. Wisdom is better than silver and gold.
h:
“Don't gain the world and lose your soul. Wisdom is better than silver and gold.” —
Bob Marley

q: The privilege of a lifetime is to become who you truly are.
h:
“The privilege of a lifetime is to become who you truly are.” —
Carl Jung

q: To some degree, you control your life by controlling your time.
h:
“To some degree, you control your life by controlling your time.” —
Conrad Hilton

q: Thoughts become things. If you see it in your mind, you will hold it in your hand.
h:
“Thoughts become things. If you see it in your mind, you will hold it in your hand.” —
Bob Proctor

q: You may forget with whom you laughed, but you will never forget with whom you wept.
h:
“You may forget with whom you laughed, but you will never forget with whom you wept. ” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
h:
“The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
h:
“Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.” —
Helen Keller

q: It's easier to go down a hill than up it but the view is much better at the top.
h:
“It's easier to go down a hill than up it but the view is much better at the top.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: Teachers open the door. You enter by yourself.
h:
“Teachers open the door. You enter by yourself. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: A tiny change today brings a dramatically different tomorrow.
h:
“A tiny change today brings a dramatically different tomorrow.” —
Richard Bach

q: Would you rather learn to deal with the truth now than be forced to do so later on?
h:
“Would you rather learn to deal with the truth now than be forced to do so later on?” —
Celestine Chua

q: If you believe you can, you can. If you believe you can't, then, well you can't.
h:
“If you believe you can, you can. If you believe you can't, then, well you can't.” —
Celestine Chua

q: The only thing new in the world is the history you do not know.
h:
“The only thing new in the world is the history you do not know.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: If he cannot stop the mind that seeks after fame and profit, he will spend his life without finding peace.
h:
“If he cannot stop the mind that seeks after fame and profit, he will spend his life without finding peace.” —
Dogen

q: Even if you're sure you can win, be careful that you can live with what you lose.
h:
“Even if you're sure you can win, be careful that you can live with what you lose.” —
Gary Keller

q: The ability to observe without evaluating is the highest form of intelligence.
h:
“The ability to observe without evaluating is the highest form of intelligence.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: When you repeat a mistake, it is not a mistake anymore: it is a decision.
h:
“When you repeat a mistake, it is not a mistake anymore: it is a decision.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: The trouble with the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat.
h:
“The trouble with the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat.” —
Lily Tomlin

q:
Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in 
your life.
h:
“Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life. ” —
Confucius

q: Why fit in when you were born to stand out?
h:
“Why fit in when you were born to stand out?” —
Dr. Seuss

q: By perseverance the snail reached the ark.
h:
“By perseverance the snail reached the ark.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: Selfishness and greed, individual or national, cause most of our troubles.
h:
“Selfishness and greed, individual or national, cause most of our troubles.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: If you have only one smile in you give it to the people you love.
h:
“If you have only one smile in you give it to the people you love.” —
Maya Angelou

q:
Kindness 
in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
h:
“Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love. ” —
Lao Tzu

q: People are doing the best that they can from their own level of consciousness.
h:
“People are doing the best that they can from their own level of consciousness.” —
Deepak Chopra

q:
Wrong does not cease to be wrong because the majority 
share in it.
h:
“Wrong does not cease to be wrong because the majority share in it.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: Your problem isn't the problem. Your reaction is the problem.
h:
“Your problem isn't the problem. Your reaction is the problem.” —
Unknown

q: One must be poor to know the luxury of giving.
h:
“One must be poor to know the luxury of giving.” —
George Eliot

q: The man who moved the mountain was the one who began carrying away the smallest stones.
h:
“The man who moved the mountain was the one who began carrying away the smallest stones.” —
Zen Proverb

q:
No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's 
not the same river and he's not the same man.
h:
“No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.” —
Heraclitus

q: I can live without money, but I cannot live without love.
h:
“I can live without money, but I cannot live without love.” —
Judy Garland

q: No idea, no matter how good, will work if it doesn't get used.
h:
“No idea, no matter how good, will work if it doesn't get used.” —
Peter A. Cohen

q: You already have every characteristic necessary for success if you recognize, claim, develop and use them.
h:
“You already have every characteristic necessary for success if you recognize, claim, develop and use them.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Sometimes you have to shut your eyes, so you can see the real beauty.
h:
“Sometimes you have to shut your eyes, so you can see the real beauty.” —
Kilian Jornet

q: The first man gets the oyster, the second man gets the shell.
h:
“The first man gets the oyster, the second man gets the shell.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q:
The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change their 
future by merely changing their attitude.
h:
“The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change their future by merely changing their attitude.” —
Oprah Winfrey
